i1.name: Crimson Pact
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Vladimir''' gains {{as|({{fd|{{#var:cp1}}}}% '''bonus''' health)}} as {{sti|ap|{{as|ability power}}}} and {{as|({{#var:cp2}}% AP)}} as {{sti|health|{{as|'''bonus''' health}}}}. These two bonuses do not stack with each other.
i1.descriptionHtml: Innate: Vladimir gains (Unknown value: #var:cp1% bonus health) as ability power and (Unknown value: #var:cp2% AP) as bonus health. These two bonuses do not stack with each other.
i1.notes:
* ''Crimson Pact'' only affects '''Vladimir's''' {{as|'''maximum''' health}} and will not increase '''Vladimir's''' {{as|'''current''' health}} to prevent '''Vladimir''' from restoring health whenever his {{as|AP}} fluctuates.
** '''Vladimir's''' {{as|'''current''' health}} can decrease to match his {{as|'''maximum''' health}} if ''Crimson Pact's'' {{as|'''bonus''' health}} is lost.
* ''Crimson Pact's'' '''bonus''' ability power {{tip|stacks multiplicatively}} with other sources of {{as|% ability power}} but its '''bonus''' health {{tip|stacks additively}} with other sources of {{as|'''bonus''' health}}.
**With {{ii|Rabadon's Deathcap}} you get a total of ({{tt|{{as|{{#var:rd}}% AP}}|From Rabadon's Deathcap.}} + {{tt|{{as|{{fd|{{#expr:{{#var:cp1}}*(1+{{#var:rd}}/100)}}}}% '''bonus''' health}}|Crimson Pact's bonus AP enhanced by Rabadon's Deathcap.}}) {{as|'''bonus''' ability power}} and ({{tt|{{as|{{#expr:{{#var:cp2}}*(1+{{#var:rd}}/100)}}% AP}}|Crimson Pact's bonus health comes from AP, thus indirectly enhanced by Rabadon's Deathcap.}} + {{tt|{{as|{{fd|{{#expr:{{#var:cp1}}*{{#var:rd}}*{{#var:cp2}}/10000}}}}% '''bonus''' health}}|Though these 2 bonuses do not stack with each other and it's Crimson Pact's bonus AP that enhanced by Rabadon's Deathcap, the enhanced part of AP is credited to Rabadon's Deathcap, not Crimson Pact, thus still counted as resource for Crimson Pact's bonus health.}}) {{as|'''bonus''' health}}.
<!--** With {{ii|Cinderhulk}} you get a total of {{tt|{{as|({{fd|{{#expr:{{#var:cp1}}*(1+{{#var:ch}}/100)}}}}% '''bonus''' health)}}|Crimson Pact's bonus AP comes from bonus health, thus indirectly enhanced by Cinderhulk.}} {{as|'''bonus''' ability power}} and ({{tt|{{as|{{#var:cp2}}% AP}}|From Crimson Pact}} + {{tt|{{as|{{#var:ch}}% '''bonus''' health}}|From Cinderhulk.}}) {{as|'''bonus''' health}}.
<!--** With {{ii|Rabadon's Deathcap}} + {{ii|Cinderhulk}} you get a total of ({{tt|{{as|{{#var:rd}}% AP}}|Same with case 1, from Rabadon's Deathcap.}} + {{tt|{{as|{{fd|{{#expr:{{#var:cp1}}*(1+{{#var:rd}}/100)*(1+{{#var:ch}}/100)}}}}% '''bonus''' health}}|Crimson Pact's bonus AP comes from bonus health, thus enhanced by both Rabadon's Deathcap and Cinderhulk, multiplicatively.}}) {{as|'''bonus''' ability power}} and ({{tt|{{as|{{#expr:{{#var:cp2}}*(1+{{#var:rd}}/100)}}% AP}}|Same with case 1, won't stack with other sources of bonus health (Cinderhulk).}} + {{tt|{{as|{{fd|{{#expr:{{#var:ch}}+{{#var:cp1}}*{{#var:rd}}*{{#var:cp2}}*(1+{{#var:ch}}/100)/10000}}}}% '''bonus''' health}}|Crimson Pact's bonus AP indirectly enhanced by Cinderhulk (refer case 2), then multiplicatively enhanced again by Rabadon's Deathcap. The enhanced part that's credited to Rabadon's Deathcap then enhances Crimson Pact's bonus health (refer case 1). Finally, add the simple bonus health from Cinderhulk.}}) {{as|'''bonus''' health}}.
-->

w1.name: Sanguine Pool
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Vladimir''' sinks into a pool of blood, gaining {{sti|ms|{{as|{{fd|37.5}}% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} which decays exponentially over 1 second and becoming {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|ghosted}} for 2 seconds.

Enemies inside the pool are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 40% and dealt {{as|magic damage}} every {{fd|0.5}} seconds over the duration. '''Vladimir''' {{tip|heals}} himself for 15% of the {{tt|pre-mitigation damage|Damage calculated before modifiers}} dealt by ''Sanguine Pool''.

'''''Vladimir''' cannot use basic attacks or abilities during Sanguine Pool, but is still able to move. If {{ai|Tides of Blood|Vladimir}} is charging at the time of Sanguine Pool's activation, that ability may still be recast.''
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Vladimir sinks into a pool of blood, gaining 37.5% bonus movement speed which decays exponentially over 1 second and becoming untargetable and ghosted for 2 seconds.
Enemies inside the pool are slowed by 40% and dealt magic damage every 0.5 seconds over the duration. Vladimir heals himself for 15% of the pre-mitigation damage dealt by Sanguine Pool.
Vladimir cannot use basic attacks or abilities during Sanguine Pool, but is still able to move. If Tides of Blood is charging at the time of Sanguine Pool's activation, that ability may still be recast.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage Per Tick|{{ap|20 to 75}} {{as|(+ {{fd|2.5}}% '''bonus''' health)}}|Maximum Magic Damage|{{ap|20*4 to 75*4}} {{as|(+ 10% '''bonus''' health)}}}}
w1.notes:
* The first tick damages immediately so the final one occurs {{fd|0.5}} seconds before '''Vladimir''' becomes targetable again.
* The {{tip|slow}} ends immediately once affected enemies get out of range.
* '''Vladimir''' can still use [[summoner spell|summoner spells]] and [[Active ability items|item actives]] during ''Sanguine Pool''.
* While unable to attack, '''Vladimir''' can still input attack commands - causing him to follow his attack target. 
** '''Vladimir's''' {{stil|attack range}} is reduced{{ft|to 0|by 450}}while pooled - causing him to attempt to move right up to his attack target.
w1.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  {{as|20%|health}} as 20 and riot's value 0,0,0,0,0 as 0

effects.str:
• Magic Damage Per Tick: (+ 2.5% bonus health)
  • Maximum Magic Damage: (+ 10% bonus health)

e1.name: Tides of Blood
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Vladimir''' {{tip|channel|charges}} for up to {{fd|1.5}} seconds, {{tip|slow|slowing}} himself by 20% if he ''charges'' for more than 1 second. ''Tides of Blood'' can be recast at any time within its duration. If '''Vladimir''' finishes charging or is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}, he automatically initiates the recast.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Vladimir''' unleashes a nova of 15 blood bolts, each of which collide with the first enemy they hit, dealing them {{as|magic damage}} that is increased based on how long ''Tides of Blood'' was charged, up to the first second.
If ''Tides of Blood'' was charged for at least 1 second, enemies hit are also {{tip|slow|slowed}} for {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
''Enemies can intercept multiple bolts, but may only be damaged once.''
''If '''Vladimir''' is below {{as|12% of his '''maximum''' health}} Tides of Blood will not cost any {{as|health}}, but will still increase in damage.''
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Vladimir charges for up to 1.5 seconds, slowing himself by 20% if he charges for more than 1 second. Tides of Blood can be recast at any time within its duration. If Vladimir finishes charging or is interrupted, he automatically initiates the recast.
Recast: Vladimir unleashes a nova of 15 blood bolts, each of which collide with the first enemy they hit, dealing them magic damage that is increased based on how long Tides of Blood was charged, up to the first second.
If Tides of Blood was charged for at least 1 second, enemies hit are also slowed for 0.5 seconds.
Enemies can intercept multiple bolts, but may only be damaged once.
If Vladimir is below 12% of his maximum health Tides of Blood will not cost any health, but will still increase in damage.
leveling: {{st|Minimum Magic Damage|{{ap|30 to 90}} {{as|(+ {{fd|1.5}}% '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|(+ 35% AP)}}|Maximum Magic Damage|{{ap|60 to 180}} {{as|(+ 6% '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|(+ 80% AP)}}}}
e1.notes:
* The spell indicator shows 11 equally spaced missile indicators when hovering the ability in the HUD, however the spell actually casts 15 equally spaced missiles.
* The {{as|health}} cost may still drop '''Vladimir''' below the specified amount if he is above it. This is verified for every tick of {{as|health}} cost, i.e if the first tick drops him below it, the next ones will stop affecting him if he remains below it.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Vladimir''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|charge|cast={{ai|Sanguine Pool|Vladimir}} is usable. {{ai|Transfusion|Vladimir}} and {{ai|Hemoplague|Vladimir}} both interrupt after {{fd|0.25}} seconds.|items=interrupts,true,interrupts,false,interrupts|spells=true,true,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts}}
e1.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  {{pp|2 to 8|0 to 0.75 by 0.25|key=%|type=charge time|label1=seconds|color=health}} as 2/3.5/5/6.5/8/1 and riot's value 0,0,0,0,0 as 0

effects.str:
• Minimum Magic Damage: (+ 1.5% maximum health) (+ 35% AP)
  • Maximum Magic Damage: (+ 6% maximum health) (+ 80% AP)

st_slices: (+ 1.5% '''maximum''' health) (+ 35% AP)

r1.name: Hemoplague
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Vladimir''' spreads a virulent plague at the target location, infecting all enemies within the area at the time of cast for 4 seconds, which [[damage modifier|increases]] the damage they take from all sources by 10% for the duration.

After the duration, the infection bursts, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all infected targets and bringing the blood from all infected enemy {{tip|champions|champions}} to '''Vladimir''' over {{fd|0.4}} seconds for him to harvest, {{tip|heal|healing}} him, reduced by 50% for each subsequent champion.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Vladimir spreads a virulent plague at the target location, infecting all enemies within the area at the time of cast for 4 seconds, which damage modifier the damage they take from all sources by 10% for the duration.
After the duration, the infection bursts, dealing magic damage to all infected targets and bringing the blood from all infected enemy champions to Vladimir over 0.4 seconds for him to harvest, healing him, reduced by 50% for each subsequent champion.
r1.notes:
* ''Hemoplague'' will amplify almost all sources and types of damage (including damage from neutral monsters but excluding {{tip|true damage|{{as|true damage}}}}, with percent modifiers stacking multiplicatively).
** ''Hemoplague'' amplifies itself for an actual {{ap|150*1.1 to 350*1.1}} {{as|(+ {{fd|77}}% AP)}} damage.
* ''Hemoplague's'' modifier to incoming damage stacks additively with {{cai|Unbreakable Will|Alistar}} for a total reduction of 45/55/65%.{{tt|*|this might be unintended}}
* {{tip|Spell shield}} does not negate the detonation.

effects.str:
• Magic damage: (+ 70% AP)

  • Heal: (+ 70% AP)
  • Reduced Heal: (+ % AP)
  • Maximum Heal: (+ % AP)
